abstract: Big banks have already taken losses of nearly $10 billion on loans gone bad, though they were far from the only institutions at fault, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column.
snippet: Big banks have already taken losses of nearly $10 billion on loans gone bad, though they were far from the only institutions at fault, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column.
lead_paragraph: From Floyd Norris’s latest column in The New York Times:

headline.main: Norris: Banks Stuck With Bill for Bad Loans
